page.title: 06Changing Times
page.content: In 1905 Tonbridge was a small market town. Rich people lived to the south and north and the poorer people in the centre near the railway. The parade was a sunken garden where vagrants would hide to rob people. There were no cinemas. The County Grammar school began in the Technical Institute. By 1925 the cinema was popular and at one time there were four. In the High Street 150 shops were privately owned. Industry, especially printing, flourished. Cricket week on the Angel ground was a highlight. House building in roads between Baltic and Springwell Roads and around Meadow Lane Estate. Transport was becoming a problem. In World War 2 two London schools were evacuated to Tonbridge. After Dunkirk troop trains stopped at Tonbridge and townsfolk gave food, chocolates and cigarettes. Aerial battles over town.
